title: Installation issue: mvapich2
body:
When building a cuda-aware version of MVAPICH2, the build fails with the PGI compiler, due to a cuda-related error. This does not happen with the GNU compiler.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install mvapich2 +cuda fabrics=sock %pgi ^libpciaccess%gcc
```
(note that the option `^libpciaccess%gcc` is because `libpciaccess` itself does not build with the PGI compiler ; the option `fabrics=sock` is because building with `psm` fails)

With the above command, the build fails with:
```
     1808    configure: WARNING: Specified --enable-cuda switch, but could not
     1809    configure: WARNING: find appropriate support
  >> 1810    configure: error: Cannot continue
  >> 1811    configure: error: /home/rlehe/spack/var/spack/stage/mvapich2-2.2-o
             u7yebowz4d5lta56bvlvoefeqjwgmg5/mvapich2-2.2/contrib/hwloc/configu
             re failed for contrib/hwloc
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux lambda-single 4.15.0-36-generic #39~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Sep 25 08:59:23 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
``` 

This uses a local version of pgi (not installed via spack):
```
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: ubuntu16.04
    paths:
      cc: /opt/pgi/linux86-64/18.4/bin/pgcc
      cxx: /opt/pgi/linux86-64/18.4/bin/pgc++
      f77: /opt/pgi/linux86-64/18.4/bin/pgfortran
      fc: /opt/pgi/linux86-64/18.4/bin/pgfortran
    spec: pgi@18.4
    target: x86_64
```
